info.name: variant
info.description: The document describes attributes of the "variant" object, which e.g. can be instantiated as database documents in a MongoDB collection.

reference_bases.description: one or more bases at start position in the reference genome, which have been replaced by the alternate_bases value; for precise variants

end.description: array of 0 (for presise sequence variants), 1 or 2 (for imprecise end position of structural variant) integers

queries.description: the query will return all variants with any overlap of the CDKN2A CDR

start.description: array of 1 or 2 (for imprecise end position of structural variant) integers

genotype.description: list of strings, which represent the (phased) alleles in which the variant was being observed

mate_name.description: Mate name (chromosome) for fusion (BRK) events; otherwise left empty. Accepting values 1-22, X, Y.

updated.description: time of the last edit of this record, in ISO8601

reference_name.description: Reference name (chromosome). Accepting values 1-22, X, Y.

digest.description: concatenated unique specific elements of the variant

variant_type.description: the variant type in case of a named (structural) variant (DUP | DEL | BRK ...)

biosample_id.description: The identifier ("biosample.id") of the biosample this variant was reported from. This is a shortcut to using the variant -> callset -> biosample chaining.

info.description: additional variant information, as defined in the example and accompanying documentation

callset_id.description: The identifier ("callset.id") of the callset this variant is part of.

alternate_bases.description: one or more bases relative to start position of the reference genome,replacing the reference_bases value; for precise variants
